feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 12 at 3:22AM AKST until January 12 at 9:00AM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM AKST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Light freezing rain occurring. Trace ice accumulations are possible. * WHERE...Valdez area. * WHEN...Until 9 AM AKST this morning. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions.

entry.title: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 12 at 1:23AM AKST until January 12 at 9:00PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM AKST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Very cold wind chills ranging 40 to 55 below are occurring. The cold wind chills will cause frostbite in as little as 10 minutes to exposed skin. * WHERE...Eastern Beaufort Sea Coast.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued January 11 at 3:22PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Snow in the Central and Eastern Interior... Light snow will continue to spread across the Central and Eastern Interior through this evening and overnight. Snow will continue to fall in areas along and north of the Yukon River, west of Ft Yukon, through Thursday. South of the Yukon River, including the Fairbanks area, snow will taper off Wednesday morning. A total of
entry.cap:areaDesc: Central Interior; Middle Tanana Valley; Southeastern Brooks Range; Upper Koyukuk Valley; Yukon Flats and Surrounding Uplands

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued January 11 at 3:22PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Snow for areas of the West Coast and Western Interior... Light snow will continue to spread across the Western Interior, Yukon Delta, and eastern Norton Sound through tonight. Most locations in these areas will receive 1 to 3 inches of snow through Thursday morning, however a band of heavier snow in the 4 to 6 inch range is expected to fall over the Middle Yukon Valleys
entry.cap:areaDesc: Eastern Norton Sound and Nulato Hills; Lower Koyukuk and Middle Yukon Valleys; Lower Yukon Valley; Yukon Delta

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued January 11 at 2:57PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...MODERATE RAINFALL AND GUSTY CONDITIONS EXPECTED THURSDAY INTO THE WEEKEND... A low pressure is paired with a long fetch of moisture that will stream moderate amounts of precipitation starting as early as Thursday. Precipitation type is expected to be mostly rain, with possible mixing overnight in the central and northern locations.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Cape Decision to Salisbury Sound Coastal Area; Cape Fairweather to Cape Suckling Coastal Area; Dixon Entrance to Cape Decision Coastal Area; Eastern Baranof Island and Southern Admiralty Island; Eastern Chichagof Island; Glacier Bay; Inner Channels from Kupreanof Island to Etolin Island; Juneau Borough and Northern Admiralty Island; Misty Fjords; Salisbury Sound to Cape Fairweather Coastal Area; Southern Inner Channels

cap:geocode.value: AKZ017 AKZ020 AKZ021 AKZ022 AKZ023 AKZ024 AKZ025 AKZ026 AKZ027 AKZ028 AKZ029

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued January 11 at 2:57PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...SNOWFALL EXPECTED THURSDAY INTO THE WEEKEND... A plume of moisture entering the panhandle Thursday is expected to bring widespread precipitation into the weekend. Temperatures are forecasted to remain near freezing along the roads, resulting in accumulating snowfall. This multiday system may accumulate up to a foot of snow along the road systems, 2 to 6 inches near Haines
entry.cap:areaDesc: Haines Borough and Lynn Canal; Taiya Inlet and Klondike Highway

entry.title: High Surf Advisory issued January 12 at 1:55AM SST by NWS
entry.summary: ...High Surf Advisory remains in effect... * SURF...Surfs of 11 to 13 feet will impact all shores of American Samoa, mainly north and west shores. * TIMING...through this morning. * IMPACTS...High surfs and strong rip currents. Fautuaga mo galu maualuluga
entry.cap:areaDesc: Manua; Swains Island; Tutuila and Aunuu

entry.title: Hydrologic Outlook issued January 12 at 1:51AM SST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Increasing threat of Flash Flooding starts today through the weekend for all islands of American Samoa... The South Pacific Convergence Zone (SPCZ) to the south of the territory will move over the islands late this afternoon. As model data projects a few low-level pressure systems to develop within the SPCZ, this will increase the likelihood of numerous to
entry.cap:areaDesc: Manua; Swains Island; Tutuila and Aunuu

entry.title: Wind Advisory issued January 12 at 5:01AM PST until January 12 at 2:00PM PST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Areas of northeast to east winds 20 to 35 mph with gusts 40 to 50 mph expected. Strongest in Los Angeles County. * WHERE...Los Angeles and Ventura County Mountains. * WHEN...Until 2 PM PST this afternoon.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Los Angeles County Mountains excluding the Santa Monica Range; Ventura County Mountains

entry.title: Wind Advisory issued January 12 at 2:55AM PST until January 12 at 10:00AM PST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM PST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Northeast winds 10 to 20 mph with gusts to 35 mph. Local gusts to 45 mph. * WHERE...San Diego County Valleys, San Bernardino and Riverside County Valleys-The Inland Empire and Orange County Inland Areas.

entry.summary: ...HEAVY RAINFALL ENDING TODAY WILL LEAD TO AN INCREASED THREAT OF LANDSLIDES IN WESTERN WASHINGTON THROUGH SATURDAY...
